Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2010 09:47PM - edited Jul 9, 2010 05:48AM by lisa34lisa Stressed out since my childhood.  Makes me think it does have something to do with it.  Then again, my Mother has had much more stress in her life than I have.... stress just about drove her crazy, and she doesn't have BC.  ????  Who knows!
Posts.Title: Stress and Breast Cancer lukejessesmom texasrose361

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2010 07:33AM lisa34lisa wrote: Again, I have to chime in with my thoughts. I have had TONS of stress.  Won't go into details, but trust me when I say it's been a lot to deal with. My mother, has had more.  Abuse (of all kinds) from a step-father since the day she was born.  CONSTANT financial issues.  Moving from one apt to the other because she couldn't pay the rent.  Lost a baby at birth.  Mental instability.  "Nervous breakdown" when I was in my early teens.  Very type A.  Always a "glass is half empty" person. AND, was on HRT for years and years because she had a hysterectomy when she was 26. She does NOT have cancer of any kind.  No health issues, other than managed high blood pressure.  She's 65.   I honestly think if stress caused cancer, my Mom would have it.

Posts.Content: lisa34lisa wrote: Its so funny.  When I was first diagnosed with my tiny little cancer, I kept hearing about "a 98% 5 yr survival rate".   What the hell???  I was only 40.  5 years???  Wasn't nearly long enough.  Almost laughable! Now, since the stage IV diagnosis, I'm BEGGING for 5 years.  Begging, crying, praying, cursing, kicking......   for just 5 more years.  I'm so pissed off right now.  Not sure WHO I'm angry with.  But, who ever it is, I just want to beat the living crap out of em!  That's all.  Just wanted to vent.  Thanks for listening. Lisa "You don't get to decide how you die. You do, however, get to decide how you live"! Dx 3/5/2010, IDC, <1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 5 yrs lisa34lisa ChocolateLover

Posts.Content: May 25, 2010 06:43PM lisa34lisa wrote: First off:  when you, Fitz, post on my topic, I always feel so special.  :)  It's like your the leader of the "popular click" and you've sat at my table at lunch.  haha. L & J's mom...I soooo know what you mean about the friend with a "problem".  You know, important crap, like someone (gasp) getting her parking spot after lunch!  "What????  You're parking spot???  You have to be kidding!!!  How will you ever get over that?"   Sometimes, I just wanta tell her to call someone else with crap like that.  But, I'm a wimp, so I don't.
Posts.Title: 5 yrs lisa34lisa ChocolateLover

Posts.Content: May 27, 2010 05:18PM lisa34lisa wrote: All of you all are great, special people.  You know that, right?  :)  Please don't get me wrong.  I'm not angry all the time.  MOST of the time  I'm sad and scared.  Like today.  I work at a family practice office.  Thank the Lord we didn't have pts this morning, because, I simply lost it.  I just could NOT stop crying.  Finally, one of the other Dr's there told me just to go home and rest for a while.  I did just that.  1 hour nap.  Felt soo much better!  Went back to work and didn't start feeling like crap again until around 4:30 or so.  side note:  that is the first time i have broken down at work.  Not sure of the reasoning, but I'm sure it's a combo of lack of E &P, and I've started having sevier joint pain, as well as stinging pains in my neck where the cancer is growing.  Just a constant reminder that I am "sick".  Bla.  All this just sucks a big one!

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2011 11:52PM - edited Jan 28, 2011 11:53PM by lisa34lisa Wow!  I am so amazed with you all!  Thanks for doing this!  It will be a huge help to others that follow! Just wanted to add:  pot/mary jane/marijuana/weed/grass/reefer...... or as medical pros would put it, Cannabis.  THAT is what you need, Paula.  Honestly, it will increase your appetite 100 fold.  (yep, I remember that from high school).  It also helps with depression, anxiety and just plain ole "feelin bad".   SE's of it are far less than just about any other drug listed on this thread.  'Cept the pickle juice, of course. Good luck to you all!  Peace out!    Haha.
Posts.Title: Halaven - Day 1 PJB Wanderingneedle

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2011 04:33AM lisa34lisa wrote: I haven't had to use it.  yet.  But..with that said, I would have no problem whatsoever using it if or when I need it. I used it... quite a bit during my "party" days.  :)  Yep, I ate a TON.  Laughed a lot.  And then, became paranoid.  I honestly believe however, that the last SE was d/t to the fact that I was using much too much at one time.  Today, if needed, I would just hit it 3 times or so.  What a relaxing feeling that would be.  (I'm about to talk myself into wanting it) haha. While I was in nursing school, we had a book that listed ALL drugs.  Medical use, as well as illegal recreational drugs.  Pot had THE LEAST SE's  of any of them... including drugs that were given to pregnant women!    And Jeanne... if you eat it, as in the brownies Paula will be making for us..  .....the trick is to only eat a small amount.  And for how long it takes to have an effect:  NOT LONG!  haha.  I think I'm gonna copy and paste some of this as a new thread.  Don't wanta highjack this one.  This one really needs to stay on topic!  :)

Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2011 03:09PM lisa34lisa wrote: Yes, God bless her!  I did hear back from GlaxoSmithKline.  They will not help.  Any.  It's not like they are a billion dollar company and can afford to give me a month of pills.  OH WAIT!!!  Yes, they are!!!!  In the past 10 months they have been paid at LEAST $25,000 by my insurance and myself!  I just can't believe they wouldn't help me out.  "we have replacement options for some drugs, but not Tykerb".  REALLY????  They will replace Levitra but not a life saving stage IV drug???  Somethings just wrong with that.  I honestly don't know what I would have done without this beautiful lady's help.
Posts.Title: left over Tykerb anyone?? need help! lisa34lisa Tina2

Posts.Content: lisa34lisa wrote: Well, I have been on Tykerb for a year now along with Herceptin.  It's doing a great job at keeping my cancer at bay. Went yesterday to Vandy to get a scan.. (good report.. not NED, but never have been).  While there I picked up my RX for Tykerb.  $2,800 that insurance paid most of. On the 5 hr car ride back, my 18 year old son and I stopped at Burger King.  I had him throw out all the trash in the car..... you guessed it!  The med was thrown out.  Didn't know until this morning!  My insurance will not pay for it again.  I do NOT have $2,800!  Maybe $28 if I search hard.  haha. Is there anyone on here that has some Tykerb that they no longer take?  I will pay via paypal for you to ship it to me.  As of this morning, I have 8 pills left.  2 days worth.  I REALLY need some help!  If you have any... please PM me.  Thanks in advance! Posts.Title: Where is everyone from? shelbyjane72 BarbaraA

Posts.Content: lisa34lisa wrote: I hope someone here remembers me.  I'm one of "those" people that only stop by when somethings going wrong. Had ovaries removed over a year ago.  No periods since then, of course. Taking Tykerb and Herceptin as well as Arimidex.  Last full body scan (on the first of this month) was great!  Less cancer now than I have had since it came back stage IV.  Almost all tumors were gone, and the ones that remained were at least 50% smaller. Started vaginal bleeding a couple of hours ago.  :(   Just like a full blown period.  I will go to the Dr tomorrow.  Don't know what I'm looking to hear from anyone.  Guess I just wanted to say "Well Shit", and have people that know the terror behind the words to hear it. "You don't get to decide how you die. You do, however, get to decide how you live"! Dx 3/5/2010, IDC, <1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2010 06:44AM lisa34lisa wrote: Well, poo yall! Here I go again questioning my oncologist.  At my last visit, I brought up Zometa d/t being on Arimidex for the past 4  months..... and hopefully for much longer.  He agreed that was a good idea.  Told me starting next month, we would do the infusion once every 3 months. hu?  seems yall have been getting them once a month?  I have an appt at Vandy this Wednesday for a second opionion.  I'll add this to my list of questions.
Posts.Title: Is stopping Zometa a safe thing to do? Joyce4123 lisa34lisa

Posts.Content: lisa34lisa wrote: So, stage IV ladies... I would like to find out what you all think about pot to manage side effects.  And be honest.  We are all big girls.  Nothing personal between any of us.  Just a debate of it's use.  I am all for it! I haven't had to use it to control any of my symptoms.  Yet.  But..with that said, I would have no problem whatsoever using it if or when I need it. I used it... quite a bit during my "party" days.  :)  Yep, I ate a TON.  Laughed a lot.  And then, became paranoid.  I honestly believe however, that the last SE was d/t to the fact that I was using much too much at one time.  Today, if needed, I would just hit it 3 times or so.  What a relaxing feeling that would be.  (I'm about to talk myself into wanting it) haha. While I was in nursing school, we had a book that listed ALL drugs.  Medical use, as well as illegal recreational drugs.  Pot had THE LEAST SE's  of any of them... including drugs that were given to pregnant women!    If you eat it, as in pot brownies  .....the trick is to only eat a small amount.  How long it takes to have an effect:  NOT LONG!  haha. So what do you all think?  Would you be willing to break the law to try it?  My vote is yes, yes and yes. "You don't get to decide how you die. You do, however, get to decide how you live"! Dx 3/5/2010, IDC, <1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2011 12:09PM lisa34lisa wrote: See there!  You ladies are the bomb!  I just love yall to pieces!  (if you're not from the south, being loved to pieces is indeed, a good thing). To remove the elephant from the room, I will address Athena.  <deep breath> I'm sorry for anything you have been through.  I honestly am.  Especially something that was caused from the simple fact that (for some reason) pot is not legal in most places.  Everything you mentioned is not a problem from the POT, it is a problem because it is not legal.  IF it were legal... no blood on anyone's hands.  Here in the states, the government at one time tried to make alcohol illegal.  Did people still drink?  Of course!  Were they doing illegal things to have that drink?  Yep!  And so... the government decided repeal the law and now... many many years later, our government is making a TON of money off of the sale.   Correct me if I'm wrong here, but, I'm 100% certain that no one in your country is having blood shed due that fact. Michelle:  you are not intruding at all!  This post is not for stage IV only.  Anyone is welcome.  :)  God Is Good:  love you for many reasons! :) Elaine:  I too, was a "just say no" kind of woman, once I became a Mom.  I  put pot in the same class as cocaine... "illegal drugs".   After further thought I have came to realize that I was wrong.  It's never too late, nor is one ever to old, to admit they are wrong.  I don't think of it as being hypocritical.  I think of it as a lesson learned.  Wisdom.    To everyone else... thank you SO much for your input!!  If you agreed, or if you didn't!  I was pleasantly surprised that we can disagree without turning to personal attacks.  :)  Again... yall rock! Legal.  Everywhere.  That's what it needs to be.  Problem solved.
Posts.Title: Pot ~ weed ~ and other cures. :) lisa34lisa radiant

Posts.Content: Jan 29, 2011 02:42PM lisa34lisa wrote: See the two post above:  it's legal.  It works.  Why, oh why, can't we all have it without fear of showing up in the police blotter!   I simply don't understand. Wish I could pack up and move to CA!  :)   Not only for the legal treatment, but for the sunshine!  I'm just about over this long, cold winter.
Posts.Title: Pot ~ weed ~ and other cures. :) lisa34lisa radiant

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2011 06:35AM lisa34lisa wrote: OR, and CO.  I never knew.  We here in TN only hear of it being legal in CA.  Gives a whole new meaning to "Rocky Mountain High"!  bahahahaha!  (sorry..  just couldn't resist)! As for the sharp response... you're correct!  There are always at least 2 opinions.  I don't mind hearing different opinions.  Not at all.    I do have one question for those of you that live in a state where it is legal:  are they broken into/robbed often?  Had crime risen since it became legal?  In other words, has there been MORE crime since the places opened, or less?

Posts.Content: May 8, 2010 11:14AM lisa34lisa wrote: I work at a primary care office.  So often, as I am working pts up, they will tell me how their ______ is KILLING them.  How they feel "half dead".  Some even go so far as to tell me that being dead might be better than _____.  Sometimes, I just wanta sream at them, "NO!!  Your ____ is NOT killing you.  It may hurt, but it isn't killing you!".  Granted, very few of my pts know about my stage IV cancer, but, it's still hard to listen to.  Some days more than others.

"You don't get to decide how you die. You do, however, get to decide how you live"! Dx 3/5/2010, IDC, <1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Dec 28, 2010 11:14AM lisa34lisa wrote: Thank you all!  Not sure why I am so scared of this!  WAIT!  Yes, I do.  It's my first foot in the door to the wonderful world of chemo.  I guess my game plan will be to take it as they tell me:  2 weeks on and 1 off.  If it's too much, I will ask to try the one wk on and one wk off.  NED????  Really?????  WOW!  That's so darn exciting!  Makes it worth it! Thanks again, ladies!  :)  Your input means more than you know.

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2011 07:52PM lisa34lisa wrote: Deak:  Thanks for the info!  Only problem I have with that is this: "The active ingredient of Marinol is synthetic THC, which has been found to relieve the nausea and vomiting associated with chemotherapy for cancer patients and to assist with loss of appetite with AIDS patients." See, synthetic.  ???  Ya know what I think the TRUE problem is re: legal use?   Drug companies.  THEY are the ones that don't want natural MJ legal.  They can make NO money off of it, if we were allowed to grow our own.  To add insult to injury, the sale of a LOT of their pain meds would decrease.  Hey!  I understand their motives!  I would fight it too, if I were them. But, I'm not.  I'm a breathing, living patient.  And it pisses me off.  Sad part is how much power they have in governement.  No wonder they spend so much money in DC.  It pays them to do so.

Posts.Content: May 27, 2010 08:08PM lisa34lisa wrote: I cry too.  Something a little sad on tv?  boo-hoo.  See a person in a wheelchair at the Dr's office.  Boo-hoo.  Watch my little lady on stage dancing.  Boo-hoo.  Have a patient tell me that the pain in their foot is "killing them".  boo-hoo.  You get the idea.
